TopicTitle: What Kind of Mod Install Do You Have?

Articles.Content:
Personally, I have very few mods aside from essentials and visual mods, under 20 mods.

Edited July 22, 2020 by DunaManiac

I have so many...  I play with RSS, informational mods, visual mods, gameplay mods, pretty much everything @Nertea makes, more parts mods, and a whole lot of dependencies.  I'm definitely in the "Extremely Modded" category.

Is it okay to check all but 2 of the boxes? I play vanilla. I play with a few mods. I play with a lot of mods. I play with gameplay mods and visual mods.

I tend to not install part only mods or play with more than 100 mods.

Visual = EVE and Scatterer

Parts =Aviation Lights, Dmagic's orbital science and SCANSat.

Gameplay = KER, Docking Alignment Indicator, Better Burn Time and Gravity Turn

That's all I got on this play through.

Visual : Texure Replacer

Parts : BDAmory, Solaris Hypernautics, Near Future Technologies and KSPIE

Gameplay : Kerbal Konstructs , NavHud, FullAutoStrut, EasyVesselSwitch, Janitor's Closet, Kerbinside, KerbalJointReinforcer and TRP Hire
Depends between installs of KSP.
Only what I consider as essential, and mostly for gameplay.

As others have already said, it varies between installs. I have a fully stock install for various testing, my main (career) install with ~30 mods, and everything in between.

In terms of what types of mods I use, it's mostly gameplay mods, with a couple of part mods - though only part mods I deem essential - Kerbal Reusability Expansion, Missing History and SCANsat, to name a few. I don't use any visual mods (not even Restock, I prefer the stock art style) as my computer is graphically challenged.

I run a moderately modded game, with 20ish mods? It's split between:

* AVP (and everything that goes with it, like Scatterer, EVE, DOE, etc.)

* OPM, because Jool isn't enough.

* Tool mods, like MechJeb and KAC.

* And finally part mods. I have the entire NearFuture set plus KerbalAtomics (gotta love Neartea) plus some extra stockalike station parts and a few other things.

I'm considering getting KAS and KIS, just to give EVAs some purpose. I might also get FTL Drive Continued so I can easily flick around the system once I've established myself.

I have three at least partially active save games and each has its own set of mods: an old 1.7.3 heavily modded version with a lot of manually added stuff and some that I added later with CKAN; a 1.8.1 JNSQ version with over a hundred mods by CKAN plus some extras added manually; and a 1.9.1 version that I’ve added as few parts to as possible (just Restock+ and Kerbalism’s parts) but included Kerbalism for a first try at life support and a whole lot of mods to make it look pretty- Spectra, TU/Magpie Mods (so shiny!), EVE/scatterer etc.- and others like MechJeb, KAC and Strategia.

Heavy. All.

I only have one active save, a career game using these mods. I'm still on 1.9.1 at the moment.
Varies due to my computer not powerful enough to run KSP with a truckload of mods. Most of them is just parts mod since I'm more interested in building stuff than exploring

Not counting Dependencies like B9PartSwitch or CommunityResourcePack, I have 17 Mods. 

7 Part Mods: CryoEngines, KW Rocketry, Stockalike Mining Expansion, Near Future Solar, NF Spacecraft, NF Exploration, Stockalike Station Parts Expansion

8 Gameplay Mods: [x] Science!, CapCom, Kerbal Engineer, KSP Rescue Pod Fix, Docking Port Alignment Indicator, Final Frontier, Kerbal Alarm Clock, and USI Life Support

And Texture Replacer which I use Exclusively for Enby Kerbals

A. Lot. Like 210. I can give a better list, but it's basically:

Jnsq, GPP secondary, gep, extrasolar, gu, and owr (all rescaled to match jnsq)

mechjeb, ker, lots of other qol stuff

EVE, restock

a bunch of restockalike parts like knes and bdb

everything nertea

some not-restockalike parts like stockish orion

unkerballed start, kct, bureacracy, oh scrap, reserch bodies

contract configurator and basically every contract pack

modified with some of my own code kerbal health, tacls

mks, rational resources, kis/kas

And that's only what I can remember away from my gamedata . It's like 15 gb in total!

Edited August 5, 2020 by Clamp-o-Tron

Wow, i have under 5 mods, i am surprised so few have lightly modded installs.

Mechjeb, AlarmClock, Kerbal Reusability Expansion, Tracking Station Evolved.

Does Module Manager count as a mod?

Edited August 5, 2020 by Boyster
95 "mods" (as defined by CKAN, some are just MM patches), plus ~30 assorted MM patches of my own and 3 horribly out-of-date mods I fixed lightly buggerised myself. A bit of everything.
20-30, and everything from Visual to Gameplay. I have too much computer for this game on my main rig, so i don't have to worry about performance too much.

92 as of right now.

Mostly gameplay and visual, and part packs like stockalike station expansion, near future solar, etc. Couple of construction mods like simple construction, extraplanetary launchpads. And @Misguided_Kerbal‘s Valor planet pack. Seriously, download that mod. It’s really great!

Edited August 14, 2020 by Lewie

I’m currently playing completely vanilla, but I usually fall into the “lightly modded” category.

Visual: None (I would love to use them but my computer’s graphics card sucks) 

Parts: KIS, KAS

Gameplay: OPM, Better Timewarp, Sigma Dimensions 
 

I’ve never really been that into heavily modding my game for two reasons:

1. Having a lot installed kind of feels unnecessary in my opinion 

2. The game takes forever to load when heavily modded and crashes are more common, as well as framerates are often lower. I’d rather have good performance than additional content that I may or may not use depending on the mission.

I have only one texture mod: Restock.

The base game is great on its own, and in my opinion, adding dozens of mods doesn't make it better.  The only things lacking are high quality part textures and atmospheric enhancements (EVE, scatterer).  But my computer is somewhat limited on RAM, so I only have Restock for parts and take framerate over graphics for EVE and scatterer.

I have 36 mods total, including dependencies:

ABCORS - This one is a lifesaver and probably my favorite mod ever next to KER, when you hover your mouse over the orbit it tells you the altitude and velocity

Better Time Warp

DMagic Orbital Science

Easy Vessel Switch

EVE

Raster Prop Monitor

Kerbal Alarm Clock

KER

KIS

ScanSat

Scatterer

Spectra - Probably the coolest visual mod out there, it is less RAM intensive but looks super cool

Once I finish my Science mode play through and start a Career save, this list is going to be about 100 mods long because of contract mods.

Edited August 17, 2020 by Kerminator1000
forgot Better Time Warp

Kerbal Alarm Clock - why this isn't stock is beyond me

MechJeb - for times when I have done something a dozen times already

Docking Port Alignment Indicator - not entirely sure why but its nice

Chatterer - just because

 

no parts mods as yet
around 25 mod, mostly part mods since i like making planes with wide variety of parts. Though amount of mods i have are limited by my 8gb ram, if i install one or two more it'll become unstable.

I have like 6-7 mods.

My computer has low ram (almost 100% used while playing this game) so I cannot have much mods or any kind of visual mod.

Iirc the only ones I have are: KIS, KAS, Texture Replacer (I don't consider this one a visual mod tbh, I only use it for the suits and visors), SCANsat and I forgot the other ones
My RSS/RO install has around 50 mods, but usually I have much less mods
